context: HPLC analysis was carried out by a liquid chromatograph Perkin–Elmer series 40 coupled with the UV/VIS detector and a chromatographic column Nova Pack C-18, 250 × 4.6 mm. BTEX analysis was performed using a mobile phase of water–acetonitrile (30.0:70.0) with the flow 0.5 mL min−1. The injected sample volume was 30 μL and the used wavelength for benzene 264 nm, toluene 250 nm, ethylbenzene 262 nm and xylene 249 nm. Organic acids were determined using the same equipment but using 211 nm with the same sample volume. The mobile phase was not modified. Therefore, no acidification was needed to obtain the organic acids concentration.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both analyzed as part of a BTEX (Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylene) study using HPLC. They are mentioned in relation to their detection wavelengths during chromatographic analysis, indicating they are part of the same analytical procedure. However, there is no discussion of their chemical interactions or specific relevance beyond their inclusion in the same analytical method.
